cont.entity_a: The sound quality is inconsistent, with some units having issues such as low volume and sound shorting. Sound quality is clear and well-balanced for the price, with good treble and mid-range but limited bass. Sound isolation is decent but not effective against all background noise. The headphones are not noise-canceling but still provide good sound isolation.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality is excellent with clear audio and good bass. Surround sound effect is effective, enhancing the listening experience. Lack of bass is noted as a downside, particularly for movie soundtracks. The headphones are not RF, so there is no radio interference.

cont.entity_a: Build quality is generally poor, with reports of flaking covering and broken connections. The headphones are prone to wiring issues, particularly at the jack.
cont.entity_b: The headphones are well-built but require line-of-sight to the transmitter.

cont.entity_a: The headphones are lightweight and comfortable for long-term use. Comfort varies, with some users finding them snug but not overly tight. Ear cups are comfortable but may not be suitable for users with larger ears.
cont.entity_b: Comfort is generally good, though prolonged use can cause ear soreness. Design could be improved, as some users find them uncomfortable after extended use.

cont.entity_a: The long cord is both a benefit and a hindrance, depending on the use case.

Durability.comm: Durability is a concern, with reports of issues.

cont.entity_a: Several users experiencing broken headphones within months.
cont.entity_b: Reports of fragile joints and parts.

cont.entity_a: The headphones are affordable and offer good value for their price.
cont.entity_b: The price is considered high, but they are seen as worth it for the quality.
Battery life is good, though rechargeable batteries eventually need replacement.
They are ideal for home theater use, providing an immersive experience. The headphones are easy to set up and connect to various devices.
